items.sentence: Even though I'm sitting here in the sun, I still feel cold.
The mouse was lured into the trap by a big piece of cheese.
Tom spends a lot of money buying things that he never uses.
What do we need to do to prevent this from happening again?
The store on the corner might sell what you're looking for.
Both my father and I went to the museum for the first time.
I didn't recognize Tom because he'd put on a lot of weight.
I wonder if Tom really wanted to go to Australia with Mary.
I wonder why Tom didn't stay in Australia for another week.
I didn't want to come to Australia, but my parents made me.
I still have to go to Australia three more times this year.
I hope that my children get more breaks in life than I did.
That was our first opportunity to spend some time together.
Are you hungry already? You should've eaten more for lunch.
Tom would never have done what you've accused him of doing.
Tom hugs his wife every morning just before he leaves home.
In certain situations, going up is easier than coming down.
The Suez Canal links the Mediterranean Sea and the Red Sea.
What I want is for you to stay with me until Tom gets here.
What I want is enough money to buy something for my mother.
